item.title: Automata
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: What are Finite State Automata and why should a programmer know about them? Formally, an FSA is a algebraic structure F = ⟨Σ, S, s0, F, δ⟩ where Σ is the input alphabet, S is a set of states, s0 ∈ S is a particular start state, F ⊆ S is a set of accepting states, and δ:S×Σ → S is the state transition function.
